intro: Athamanta grisea, commonly known as the gray leaved daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its gray-green foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Athamanta grisea is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to arid conditions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
